derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Portuguese ema. The word originally denoted the cassowary, later the greater rhea; current usage dates from the early 19th cent

encyclopedia.content: EMU是一个法国时尚女装品牌，EMU还是Emulator的缩写，它是一种程序，原意为“仿真器”，同时还指澳洲鸵鸟，也是东密歇根大学的简称，也指货币同盟（1865年-1880年）(EconomicandMonetaryUnion；EMU)。

entry.tran: 鸸鹋（见于澳大利亚的大型鸟，不能飞行）
entry.def: An emu is a large Australian bird which cannot fly.

means.word_mean: 1. any of various systems of units for measuring electricity and magnetism
2. large Australian flightless bird similar to the ostrich but smaller
